Package gui.OrderScreens

Class PaymentScreenController

java.lang.Object
gui.ScreenController
gui.OrderScreens.PaymentScreenController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class PaymentScreenController extends ScreenController implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The PaymentScreenController class is a controller class for the PaymentScreen.fxml file. It handles all the events that happens in the PaymentScreen and communicates with the server to make sure the payment is successful and the order is placed. It implements Initializable interface to initialize the PaymentScreen.
Since:
2020-11-11
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ron & Nitsan

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL arg0, ResourceBundle arg1)
      Initializes the elements of the PaymentScreen. This method is called by JavaFX when the FXML file is loaded.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      arg0 - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      arg1 - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • callCreditCardCompany

      private boolean callCreditCardCompany(String cardNumber, String cardName, String cardYear, String cardMonth, String cardCVV, float totalPrice)

    • rememberMyCard

      void rememberMyCard(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      This method allows the user to remember the credit card information for future use.
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggered the execution of this method, in this case, a mouse click.

    • exit

      void exit(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      This method is responsible for handling the exit button event. It closes the program when the exit button is pressed.
      Parameters:
      event - the event of the mouse clicking on the exit button.

    • goBack

      void goBack(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      This method is responsible for handling the back button event. It navigates the user to the previous screen when the back button is pressed.
      Parameters:
      event - the event of the mouse clicking on the back button.

    • delayPay

      void delayPay(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      This method is responsible for handling the delay button event. It allows the user to delay the delivery of the order when the delay button is pressed.
      Parameters:
      event - the event of the mouse clicking on the delay button.

    • pay

      void pay(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      The method that handle the payment process, it get the credit card details, check if the details are valid, if so it will create a new invoice, and send a request to update the status of the order to the server.
      Parameters:
      event - : a mouse event that happen when the user click the pay button

    • checkCart

      Boolean checkCart(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Method to check the cart of a customer.
      Parameters:
      event - the event that triggers the method
      Returns:
      boolean: true if the cart is empty or there is an issue with the data received from the warehouse/machine, false otherwise.

    • generateInvoice

      void generateInvoice(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event, boolean isdelayed)
      This method is responsible for generating the invoice for the current order and updating the order status, order ID and confirmation date. It also sets the estimated delivery time and machine ID if the supply method is machine pickup or instant pickup.
      Parameters:
      event - the event that triggers this method, usually a mouse click on a button
      isdelayed - a boolean value that indicates whether the order is delayed or not
